settings.body: At Cage Marshall Consulting, we've been helping pilots reach their career goals since 1988. No matter what the circumstances, as a Cage Marshall-trained interviewee, you will come off as prepared and professional, ready to overcome any obstacle thrown at you during the interview process. We can help you at every phase of your career, from university through post-retirement. We take a vested interest in all our clients, and are dedicated to helping you achieve your dream job. Your success is our success.
settings.specialties:
Career Consulting
Resume & Cover Letter Creation
Application Reviews
Interview Preparation

settings.description: American Patrols hires 400-hour pilots to inspect oil pipelines near Midland, TX, in C-172s. It's a 1-year contract with 20-25 hours of flying per week.
The National Agricultural Aviation Association (NAAA) is a great source of information for getting started as an agriculture pilot.

Companies like Ameriflight will typically hire First Officers with about 500 hours of total time. Working for Ameriflight is a good job in and of itself, but they also have a Flightpath program with UPS.

Operating out of Denver, Key Lime flies cargo in Metroliners and Brasilias. They offer the opportunity to progress up to passenger operations in the Dornier 328Jet. Companies like Key Lime Air will typically hire First Officers with about 500 hours of total time.
There are good fixed-wing tour jobs out there that even involve turboprop time. Grand Canyon Airlines has no shortage of demand for rides in their De Havilland Twin Otters.
There are many tour operators in Hawaii. TomBareFoot.com has a great list of operators. We recommend you use this to decide whom to call.
Most backcountry flight operations are relatively small. You'll have to dig to find them, but they are there. Backcountry Flying Experience operates in Montana.
Middle Fork Aviation advertises bush flying and scenic flights in Idaho.
Gem Air provides both backcountry flying and has a cargo operation that you could move up to when you get enough hours. They operate in Idaho.
Wrangell Mountain Air is one of countless backcountry operators in Alaska.

​​The CBP operates one of the largest non-military air forces in the world. They fly fixed- and rotary-wing aircraft, offer steady pay and benefits, a government pension, the opportunity for promotion, and lots of flying.
Many departments in the Federal government have pilot jobs available. This article on the GSA website explains what departments might list job vacancies.
When federal government job listings appear, they're usually on the USAJobs website.
PSA is a wholly owned subsidiary of American Airlines that has unparalleled opportunities for growth and professional development.
American is a major U.S. airline headquartered in Fort Worth, Texas. It is the world's largest airline when measured by fleet size, scheduled passengers carried, and revenue passenger mile.
Delta is one of the major airlines of the U.S. and a legacy carrier. One of the world's oldest airlines in operation, Delta is headquartered in Atlanta, GA.

Southwest is one of the major airlines of the U.S. and the world's largest low cost carrier. It is headquartered in Dallas, Texas and has scheduled service to 121 destinations in the U.S. and 10 additional countries.

United is a major U.S. airline headquartered in Chicago, Illinois. United operates a large domestic and international route network spanning cities large and small across the United States and all six inhabited continents.

Alaska Airlines is a major US-based airline headquartered in SeaTac, Washington. It is the sixth largest airline in North America when measured by fleet size, scheduled passengers carried, and the number of destinations served.
UPS Airlines is an American cargo airline based in Louisville, Kentucky. The second-largest cargo airline worldwide, UPS Airlines flies to 815 destinations worldwide.
Federal Express is a major American cargo airline based in Memphis, Tennessee. As of 2020, it is one of the world's largest airlines in terms of fleet size and freight tons flown.
Delta Private Jets operates jet aircraft as a subsidiary of Delta Air Lines. Its main base is Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky International Airport.

Boutique Air is a commuter airline based in San Francisco, CA. The airline offers charter services as well as scheduled passenger services. Boutique operates the second largest PC-12 fleet in the United States with 26 aircraft
JetBlue Airways is a major American low cost airline, and the seventh largest airline in North America by passengers carried. JetBlue Airways is headquartered in Long Island City.
Allegiant Air is an American ultra-low cost airline that operates scheduled and charter flights. As a major air carrier, it is the fourteenth-largest commercial airline in North America.
Spirit Airlines is the leading ultra-low cost carrier in the United States, the Caribbean and Latin America. Spirit flies to 60+ destinations.
Frontier Airlines is a ultra low-cost carrier headquartered in Denver, Colorado. Frontier operates flights to over 100 destinations throughout the United States and 31 international destinations.
JSX exists to make short distance flying simple, fast and enjoyable. JSX is designated a "Top Workplace in the US" by Energage
SkyWest Airlines is a leading regional airline serving millions of North America travelers monthly.
Endeavor Air, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Delta Air Lines, is the world's largest operator of MHI RJ CRJ-900 aircraft.
Mesa Airlines pilots enjoy a great quality of life in the regional airline industry. From their top-rated pilot training to our leading captain upgrade times, Mesa's goal is your success.
For nearly 50 years, Republic Airways has led the regional airline industry in innovation and operational excellence.

As a GoJet pilot you will be joining a talented, growing and energized team flying for United Airlines. With new CRJ-550s coming every month, prepare for growth as you receive great starting pay and quick upgrades.
As a wholly owned subsidiary of American Airlines Group, Envoy offers a direct career path to American, the world's largest airline.

Operating as a regional airline in the U.S., Air Wisconsin Airlines performs flying services for United Airlines as United Express throughout the Midwest and East Coast, operating CRJ-200 regional jets
Atlas Air’s technologically advanced fleet of 747s, 777s, 767s, and 737s offers flexible, creative, and award-winning solutions.
When you join Cape Air you will experience hands-on, industry-leading, real-world opportunities that will offer flexibility and growth, and more importantly, fuel your passion for aviation.

Breeze Airways is a US-based airline founded by David Neeleman, who previously co-founded Morris Air, WestJet, JetBlue, and Azul Linhas Aereas. Breeze provides nonstop service between underserved routes across the U.S.
CommutAir is a regional airline operating flights on behalf of United Airlines as a United Express partner. They have a fleet of Embraer 145 aircraft that operates up to 1,500 weekly flights.
ExpressJet Airlines operates Embraer ERJ145 regional jet aircraft and has more than 40 years of experience as a regional airline.
Aha! is a leisure airline operated by ExpressJet. They provide travelers in smaller communities with convenient, short, nonstop flights to high-quality destinations like the Reno-Lake Tahoe region.
Hawaiian Airlines is the largest operator of commercial flights to and from the U.S. state of Hawaii. It is the tenth-largest commercial airline in the United States.
Horizon Air is an American regional airline sister carrier to Alaska Airlines. They are both subsidiaries of Alaska Air Group.
Piedmont is a wholly owned subsidiary of American Airlines. It operates nearly 400 daily departures to 55+ cities throughout the eastern United States.
PlaneSense is a larger charter company that works much like the airlines.
NetJets is an American company that sells fractional ownership shares in private business jets. NetJets became the first private business jet charter and aircraft management company in the world.
Flexjet is an American provider of fractional ownership aircraft, leasing, and jet card services.
Jet Linx is a larger charter company that works much like the airlines.
Air Share is one of the nation’s largest fractional aircraft providers.
Wheels Up is a private jet charter company that allows members to book short-and-medium range private charter flights at an all-inclusive hourly rate.
Sun Country Airlines is a US-based ultra-low-cost passenger and cargo airline, and the eleventh largest in the US by passengers carried.
Atlas Air’s technologically advanced fleet of 747s, 777s, 767s, and 737s offers flexible, creative, and award-winning solutions.

ATI is an airline based in Wilmington, Ohio. It operates worldwide cargo charters and combi charters for the express package industry and freight forwarders, as well as for the United States Department of Defense.
Kalitta Air is an FAR 121 Air Carrier and a leading provider of air cargo transportation, offering both scheduled and chartered transportation services.
Current aviation jobs from the National Business Aviation Association
Current pilot jobs listing for Executive Jet Management. EJM is a NetJets company and the largest aircraft management and charter company in the industry.
Elevate Jet is a boutique aircraft management company that provides specialized services to private aircraft owners and flyers throughout the world.

settings.event_name: Up in the Air Webinar Series
National Aviation Academy Career Fair – Maintenance Students and Alumni
EAA Air Venture at Oshkosh – Pilots, Maintenance techs, Flight Operations
OBAP (Organization of Black Aerospace Professionals) – Pilots
National Aviation Academy Career Fair – Maintenance Students and Alumni

settings.name: AOPA Foundation Scholarship
settings.additional_criteria:
• Must be 16 years at the time of application
  • Must hold a student pilot certificate

settings.name: AOPA Foundation You Can Fly High School Scholarship
settings.additional_criteria:
• High school student (age 16-18 years old)
  • Minimum GPA of 2.7
  • Must have passed the FAA Private Pilot written knowledge exam before application submission.

settings.name: Boeing Professional Flight Training Scholarship
settings.additional_criteria: The applicant must be, at the time of application and scholarship award, a high school graduate and at least 18 years of age.

settings.name: CECI Stratford Flight Training Scholarship
settings.additional_criteria:
• Must be 16 years at the time of application submission.
  • Female applicants only

settings.name: THE FRED AND DIANE FITTS MEMORIAL FLIGHT TRAINING SCHOLARSHIP BY CAA
settings.additional_criteria:
• Age 17-35 years at the time of application submission.
  • Preference is given to applicants interested in becoming corporate pilots, members of CAA and their relatives, and employees of CAA-preferred FBOs and their relatives

settings.name: Adapt to Fly Scholarship
settings.additional_criteria: You must be at least 16 years old to apply for a flight training scholarship.

settings.name: Air Academy Alumni Scholarship
settings.additional_criteria: You must be at least 16 years old to apply for a flight training scholarship.

settings.additional_criteria: You must be at least 16 years old to apply for a flight training scholarship.

settings.additional_criteria: You must be at least 16 years old to apply for a flight training scholarship.

settings.additional_criteria: You must be at least 16 years old to apply for a flight training scholarship.

settings.name: Jason Kurt Lohr Aviation Scholarship
settings.additional_criteria: You must be at least 16 years old to apply for a flight training scholarship.

settings.additional_criteria: You must be at least 16 years old to apply for a flight training scholarship.

settings.additional_criteria: You must be at least 16 years old to apply for a flight training scholarship.

settings.additional_criteria: You must be at least 16 years old to apply for a flight training scholarship.

settings.additional_criteria: You must be at least 16 years old to apply for a flight training scholarship.

settings.name: Tinker Murdock Family Scholarship
settings.additional_criteria: You must be at least 16 years old to apply for a flight training scholarship.

settings.name: Will Martin Flight Training Scholarship
settings.additional_criteria: You must be at least 16 years old to apply for a flight training scholarship.

settings.name: Wilson “Tex” Edwards Memorial Scholarship
settings.additional_criteria: You must be at least 16 years old to apply for a flight training scholarship.

settings.name: Heather McRoberts Memorial Scholarship
settings.additional_criteria: You must be at least 16 years old to apply for a flight training scholarship.

settings.name: Matthew Platt Scholarship
settings.additional_criteria: You must be at least 16 years old to apply for a flight training scholarship.

settings.name: Fall First Wings Scholarship
settings.additional_criteria:
• Female only.
  • Applicants must be Student Pilot Members for three months prior to the First Wings submission deadline and have logged five hours flight time within the preceding six months.

settings.name: AE Flight Training Scholarship
settings.additional_criteria: Female applicants only.

settings.name: BILL COWDEN MEMORIAL AVIATION SCHOLARSHIP
settings.additional_criteria: Available to Private Pilots of all ages.

settings.name: UAA Janice K. Barden Aviation Scholarship
settings.additional_criteria:
Applicants must be:

  • U.S citizen or permanent resident.
  • Full-time undergraduate student enrolled at an NBAA/UAA member institution.
  • Sophomore or higher.
  • Enrolled in aviation-related program.
  • Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above

settings.name: AAERO Scholarship
settings.additional_criteria:
Applicants must be:

  • 18 years or older
  • Located within the U.S.
  • Possess a student certificate
  • Have a flight school/CFI selected

settings.name: Women in Aviation Scholarships
settings.additional_criteria: Applicants must be a member of WAI to apply

settings.name: The LeRoy W. Homer Jr. Scholarships
settings.additional_criteria:
Applicants must be:

  • U.S. citizen or permanent resident.
  • Between 16 and 23 years old before the application deadline.
  • Enrolled in any college or aviation program

settings.name: UAA Scholarships
settings.additional_criteria: Varies based on scholarship

settings.name: OBAP Scholarships
settings.additional_criteria: Varies based on scholarships

settings.name: PAPA Scholarships
settings.additional_criteria: Varies based on scholarship, but must be a PAPA member.

settings.name: LPA Scholarships
settings.additional_criteria: Varies based on scholarship, but must be an LPA member.

settings.name: Judith Resnik Memorial Scholarship
settings.additional_criteria:
• Must be a female US citizen.
  • Must hold either a first class or second class medical.
  • Must maintain a 3.0 or better GPA in a college program or a graduate with same.
  • Must hold the following: Private Pilot Certificate, Instrument Rating, Single Engine Commercial Pilot Certificate with Instrument Rating or Single Engine ATP, CFI-A Written, FOI Written, CFI-I Written and Spin Endorsement.

settings.name: Stripes to Bars
settings.additional_criteria:
• Applicants must be currently serving, in good standing, or have previously served in one of the eight federal uniformed services with a discharge under other than “dis-honorable“ status.
  • Applicants must obtain an aviation medical certificate (1st class required for career track, 3rd class for non-career track).

settings.name: Grants
settings.certificate_rating: Primary certification (Sport, Recreational or Private Pilot certificate)
settings.additional_criteria:
• Must be 16 years at the time of application submission
  • Must hold a student pilot certificate

settings.name: FAFSA Grants
settings.additional_criteria: The fastest way to get started is by submitting the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA®) form. Submitting this will provide you with all the applicable Federal Grants and Federal Loans that you qualify for. Most Grants are need-based.

settings.name: Loans
settings.certificate_rating: Primary certification (Sport, Recreational or Private Pilot certificate)
settings.additional_criteria:
• Must be 16 years at the time of application submission
  • Must hold a student pilot certificate

settings.name: AOPA Flight Training Loans
settings.additional_criteria:
• Must be an AOPA member.
  • The Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association (AOPA) is one of the largest pilot advocacy organizations in the world.
  • They offer flight training loans up to $100,000.

settings.name: WeFly Learn to Fly
settings.additional_criteria:
• Pilot school loans provide a fixed-rate line of credit from $5,000 to $30,000.
  • Access your line of credit and transfer funds to your checking account online, reducing time and stress managing receipts, faxes and wire transfers.

settings.name: Wells Fargo
settings.additional_criteria: A Wells Fargo Collegiate® student loan may help you pay for the costs associated with your professional and commercial flight training program.

settings.name: Skybound
settings.additional_criteria: FMS meets students where they are on their financial and academic journey, working together to create a lending solution that becomes a benefit, not a burden.

settings.name: American Flyers / Sallie Mae
settings.award: Private, Instrument, Commercial, Multi-Engine, CFI, CFII
settings.additional_criteria:
• Sallie Mae helps you get the money you need, plus features that can help make your education possible.
  • You can apply for the money you need, plus flexible options for repayment and the ability to add a cosigner to increase your approval.
  • Sallie Mae can help make your flight training and career dreams possible.

settings.name: American Airlines Credit Union
settings.additional_criteria: Take advantage of this open-end, variable-rate loan with terms up to 120 months and amounts up to $40,000.

settings.scholarships_text: Use personalized filters to sort through hundreds of scholarships to find the ones that meet your specific situation.
settings.grants_text: Grants are an overlooked, yet powerful financing option. Don’t miss out - learn more about different grant opportunities.
settings.loans_text: There are many lenders that provide affordable and flexible financing options. Check out our trusted lenders to see if a flight training loan is right for you!

settings.description: Pilot Pipeline premium users have access to $50 million worth of aviation scholarships. Filter based on demographics, eligibility criteria, the training you’d like to finance, location, and more to find scholarships that meet your needs.
Great scholarships for different aviation professionals of all different experience levels.
FAPA.aero has compiled 550 scholarships into a single document to make paying for flight training more affordable.
AOPA scholarships are available in multiple categories, including primary (sport, recreational, and private pilot) certification, instrument rating, and aviation maintenance technician certification.
